settings.text: Moissanite or Cubic Zirconia: What's Best for You?

settings.content:

Many people also appreciate that moissanite is ethically sourced and generally more affordable than diamonds, making it a great balance of quality and cost-effectiveness for those who plan to wear their jewelry daily.

settings.text: Sterling Silver or Gold Vermeil: Which Should You Choose?

settings.content:
Another critical factor is the metal type. Awareness Avenue offers both vermeil and solid gold promise rings, each with its own benefits.

Vermeil: Affordable Luxury

Vermeil (pronounced ver-MAY) is sterling silver coated with a thick layer of gold (at least 2.5 microns). It offers the luxurious look of solid gold at a fraction of the price. However, with time, the gold layer may wear down.

S925 Sterling Silver: A Classic

S925 Sterling Silver is a beautiful and quality metal for your engagement ring. Cost-effective and shiny, it comes as a great option. However it is more prone to tarnishing over time than vermeil.

Which Should You Choose?

  • If you've got the budget and want a high-end look, go for vermeil.
  • If your budget is tighter, and you want as high a quality you can get S925 sterling silver is a good option for you.
